Herbal remedies: One creative solution for treating a common cold without medication would be to utilize herbal remedies. Herbs such as eucalyptus, peppermint, and ginger have natural decongestant and anti-inflammatory properties, which could help alleviate symptoms like congestion and sore throats.

Honey and lemon: Honey has antibacterial properties, and when mixed with lemon juice, it can help soothe a sore throat and reduce coughing. This remedy is not only natural but also tastes good and can be given to children.
Gargling with salt water: Gargling with warm salt water can help reduce swelling in the throat and ease congestion. Salt water also has antibacterial properties that can help fight off infections.
Steam inhalation: Inhaling steam from a bowl of hot water or a steam humidifier can help loosen mucus and ease congestion. Adding eucalyptus oil or menthol to the water can enhance its effectiveness.

Soup and tea: Sipping on warm soup or tea, such as chicken noodle soup or ginger tea, can help soothe a sore throat and provide hydration. These liquids can also help thin out mucus and make it easier to expel.
